verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> of Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> came again to me, <S%H559><s%> saying,
You, <S%H1121><s%> son of man, <S%H120><s%> take up <S%H5375><s%> a lamentation <S%H7015><s%> over Tyre; <S%H6865><s%>

and tell <S%H559><s%> Tyre, <S%H6865><s%> you who dwell <S%H3427><s%> at the entry <S%H3997><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> who are the merchant <S%H7402><s%> of the peoples <S%H5971><s%> to many <S%H7227><s%> islands, <S%H339><s%> thus says <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> Yahweh: <S%H3069><s%> You, <S%H6865><s%> Tyre, have said, <S%H559><s%> I am perfect <S%H3632><s%> in beauty. <S%H3308><s%>
Your borders <S%H1366><s%> are in the heart <S%H3820><s%> of the seas; <S%H3220><s%> your builders <S%H1129><s%> have perfected <S%H3634><s%> your beauty. <S%H3308><s%>

They have made <S%H1129><s%> all your planks <S%H3871><s%> of fir trees <S%H1265><s%> from Senir; <S%H8149><s%> they have taken <S%H3947><s%> a cedar <S%H730><s%> from Lebanon <S%H3844><s%> to make <S%H6213><s%> a mast for you. <S%H8650><s%>

Of the oaks <S%H437><s%> of Bashan <S%H1316><s%> have they made <S%H6213><s%> your oars; <S%H4880><s%> they have made <S%H6213><s%> your benches <S%H7175><s%> of ivory <S%H8127><s%> inlaid <S%H1323><s%> in boxwood, <S%H839><s%> from the islands <S%H339><s%> of Kittim. <S%H3794><s%>

Of <S%H4666><s%> fine linen <S%H8336><s%> with embroidered work <S%H7553><s%> from Egypt <S%H4714><s%> was your sail, <S%H5251><s%> that it might be to you for a banner; <S%H8504><s%> blue and purple <S%H713><s%> from the islands <S%H339><s%> of Elishah <S%H473><s%> was your awning. <S%H4374><s%>

The inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Sidon <S%H6721><s%> and Arvad <S%H719><s%> were your rowers: <S%H7751><s%> your wise <S%H2450><s%> men, <S%H6865><s%> Tyre, were in you, <S%H2259><s%> they were your pilots.

The old <S%H2205><s%> men of Gebal <S%H1380><s%> and the wise <S%H2450><s%> men of it were in you your repairers <S%H919><s%> of ship seams: <S%H591><s%> all the ships of the sea <S%H3220><s%> with their mariners <S%H4419><s%> were in you to deal <S%H6148><s%> in your merchandise. <S%H4627><s%>

Persia <S%H6539><s%> and Lud <S%H3865><s%> and Put <S%H6316><s%> were in your army, <S%H2428><s%> your men <S%H582><s%> of war: <S%H4421><s%> they hanged <S%H8518><s%> the shield <S%H4043><s%> and helmet <S%H3553><s%> in you; <S%H5414><s%> they set forth your comeliness. <S%H1926><s%>

The men <S%H1121><s%> of Arvad <S%H719><s%> with your army <S%H2428><s%> were on your walls <S%H2346><s%> all around, <S%H5439><s%> and valorous <S%H1575><s%> men were in your towers; <S%H4026><s%> they hanged <S%H8518><s%> their shields <S%H7982><s%> on your walls <S%H2346><s%> all around; <S%H5439><s%> they have <S%H3634><s%> perfected <S%H3634><s%> your beauty. <S%H3308><s%>

Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> was your merchant <S%H5503><s%> by reason of the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of all kinds of riches; <S%H1952><s%> with silver, <S%H3701><s%> iron, <S%H1270><s%> tin, <S%H913><s%> and lead, <S%H5777><s%> they traded <S%H5414><s%> for your wares. <S%H5801><s%>

Javan, <S%H3120><s%> Tubal, <S%H8422><s%> and Meshech, <S%H4902><s%> they were your traffickers; <S%H7402><s%> they traded <S%H5414><s%> the persons <S%H5315><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> and vessels <S%H3627><s%> of brass <S%H5178><s%> for your merchandise. <S%H4627><s%>
They of the house <S%H1004><s%> of Togarmah <S%H8425><s%> traded <S%H5414><s%> for your wares with horses <S%H5483><s%> and war horses <S%H6571><s%> and mules. <S%H6505><s%>

The men <S%H1121><s%> of Dedan <S%H1719><s%> were your traffickers; <S%H7402><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> islands <S%H339><s%> were the market <S%H5506><s%> of your hand: <S%H3027><s%> they brought <S%H7725><s%> you in exchange <S%H814><s%> horns <S%H7161><s%> of ivory <S%H8127><s%> and ebony. <S%H1894><s%>

Syria <S%H758><s%> was your merchant <S%H5503><s%> by reason of the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of your handiworks: <S%H4639><s%> they traded <S%H5414><s%> for your wares <S%H5801><s%> with emeralds, <S%H5306><s%> purple, <S%H713><s%> and embroidered work, <S%H7553><s%> and fine linen, <S%H948><s%> and coral, <S%H7215><s%> and rubies. <S%H3539><s%>

Judah, <S%H3063><s%> and the land <S%H776><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> they were your traffickers: <S%H7402><s%> they traded <S%H5414><s%> for your merchandise <S%H4627><s%> wheat <S%H2406><s%> of Minnith, <S%H4511><s%> and confections, <S%H6436><s%> and honey, <S%H1706><s%> and oil, <S%H8081><s%> and balm. <S%H6875><s%>

Damascus <S%H1834><s%> was your merchant <S%H5503><s%> for the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of your handiworks, <S%H4639><s%> by reason of the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of all kinds of riches, <S%H1952><s%> with the wine <S%H3196><s%> of Helbon, <S%H2463><s%> and white <S%H6713><s%> wool. <S%H6785><s%>

Vedan <S%H2051><s%> and Javan <S%H3120><s%> traded <S%H235><s%> with yarn for <S%H5414><s%> your wares: <S%H5801><s%> bright <S%H6219><s%> iron, <S%H1270><s%> cassia, <S%H6916><s%> and calamus, <S%H7070><s%> were among your merchandise. <S%H4627><s%>
Dedan <S%H1719><s%> was your trafficker <S%H7402><s%> in precious <S%H2667><s%> cloths <S%H899><s%> for riding. <S%H7396><s%>

Arabia, <S%H6152><s%> and all the princes <S%H5387><s%> of Kedar, <S%H6938><s%> they were the merchants <S%H5503><s%> of your hand; <S%H3027><s%> in lambs, <S%H3733><s%> and rams, <S%H352><s%> and goats, <S%H6260><s%> in these were they your merchants. <S%H5503><s%>

The traffickers <S%H7402><s%> of Sheba <S%H7614><s%> and Raamah, <S%H7484><s%> they were your traffickers; <S%H7402><s%> they traded <S%H5414><s%> for your wares <S%H5801><s%> with the chief <S%H7218><s%> of all spices, <S%H1314><s%> and with all precious <S%H3368><s%> stones, <S%H68><s%> and gold. <S%H2091><s%>

Haran <S%H2771><s%> and Canneh <S%H3656><s%> and Eden, <S%H5729><s%> the traffickers <S%H7402><s%> of Sheba, <S%H7614><s%> Asshur <S%H804><s%> and Chilmad, <S%H3638><s%> were your traffickers. <S%H7402><s%>

These were your traffickers <S%H7402><s%> in choice <S%H4360><s%> wares, <S%H1545><s%> in wrappings of blue <S%H8504><s%> and embroidered work, <S%H7553><s%> and in chests <S%H1595><s%> of rich clothing, <S%H1264><s%> bound <S%H2280><s%> with cords <S%H2256><s%> and made of cedar, <S%H729><s%> among your merchandise. <S%H4819><s%>

The ships <S%H591><s%> of Tarshish <S%H8659><s%> were your caravans <S%H7788><s%> for your merchandise: <S%H4627><s%> and you were replenished, <S%H4390><s%> and made very <S%H3966><s%> glorious <S%H3513><s%> in the heart <S%H3820><s%> of the seas. <S%H3220><s%>

Your rowers <S%H7751><s%> have brought <S%H935><s%> you into great <S%H7227><s%> waters: <S%H4325><s%> the east <S%H6921><s%> wind <S%H7307><s%> has broken <S%H7665><s%> you in the heart <S%H3820><s%> of the seas. <S%H3220><s%>

Your riches, <S%H1952><s%> and your wares, <S%H5801><s%> your merchandise, <S%H4627><s%> your mariners, <S%H4419><s%> and your pilots, <S%H2259><s%> your repairers <S%H919><s%> of ship seams, <S%H6148><s%> and the dealers in your merchandise, <S%H4627><s%> and all your men <S%H582><s%> of war, <S%H4421><s%> who are in you, <S%H6951><s%> with all your company which is in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of you, <S%H5307><s%> shall fall into the heart <S%H3820><s%> of the seas <S%H3220><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of your ruin. <S%H4658><s%>
At the sound <S%H6963><s%> of the cry <S%H2201><s%> of your pilots <S%H2259><s%> the suburbs <S%H4054><s%> shall shake. <S%H7493><s%>

All who handled <S%H8610><s%> the oar, <S%H4880><s%> the mariners, <S%H4419><s%> and all the pilots <S%H2259><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> shall come down <S%H3381><s%> from their ships; <S%H591><s%> they shall stand <S%H5975><s%> on the land, <S%H776><s%>

and shall cause their voice <S%H6963><s%> to be heard <S%H8085><s%> over you, <S%H2199><s%> and shall cry bitterly, <S%H4751><s%> and shall cast up <S%H5927><s%> dust <S%H6083><s%> on their heads, <S%H7218><s%> they shall wallow <S%H6428><s%> themselves in the ashes: <S%H665><s%>

and they shall make <S%H7144><s%> themselves bald <S%H7139><s%> for you, <S%H2296><s%> and clothe them with sackcloth, <S%H8242><s%> and they shall weep <S%H1058><s%> for you in bitterness <S%H4751><s%> of soul <S%H5315><s%> with bitter <S%H4751><s%> mourning. <S%H4553><s%>

In their wailing <S%H5204><s%> they shall take up <S%H5375><s%> a lamentation <S%H7015><s%> for you, <S%H6969><s%> and lament over you, <S%H6865><s%> saying, Who is there like Tyre, like her who is brought to silence <S%H1822><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of the sea? <S%H3220><s%>

When your wares <S%H5801><s%> went forth <S%H3318><s%> out <S%H3318><s%> of the seas, <S%H3220><s%> you filled <S%H7646><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> peoples; <S%H5971><s%> you enriched the kings <S%H4428><s%> of the earth <S%H776><s%> with the multitude <S%H7230><s%> of your riches <S%H1952><s%> and of your merchandise. <S%H4627><s%>

In the time <S%H6256><s%> that you were broken <S%H7665><s%> by the seas <S%H3220><s%> in the depths <S%H4615><s%> of the waters, <S%H4325><s%> your merchandise <S%H4627><s%> and all your company <S%H6951><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> in your midst. <S%H8432><s%>

All the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the islands <S%H339><s%> are astonished <S%H8074><s%> at you, <S%H4428><s%> and their kings are horribly <S%H8178><s%> afraid; <S%H8175><s%> they are troubled <S%H7481><s%> in their face. <S%H6440><s%>
The merchants <S%H5503><s%> among the peoples <S%H5971><s%> hiss <S%H8319><s%> at you; <S%H1091><s%> you are become a terror, and you shall nevermore have any being. <S%H5704><s%>
